intro: Impatiens yunlingensis, commonly known as Yunling touch-me-not, is a species of flowering plant native to the Yunnan province in China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is herbaceous, with upright stems and broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
